pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:0.5: 64. The second training rule on trainee nuns
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.2: At that time the nuns were giving the full admission to trainee nuns who had trained in the six rules for two years, but who had not been approved by the Sangha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.4: “Come, trainee nuns, find out about this,” “Give this,” “Bring this,” “There’s need for this,” or “Make this allowable.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.6: “Venerables, we’re not trainee nuns. We’re nuns.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.7: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.8: “How can nuns give the full admission to trainee nuns who have trained for two years in the six rules, but who haven’t been approved by the Sangha?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.13: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.15: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.16: “Monks, approval is required for the full admission of a trainee nun who has trained for two years in the six rules.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.17: And it should be given like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.18: After approaching the Sangha of nuns, that trainee nun should put her upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the nuns. She should then squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.19: ‘Venerables, I, the trainee nun so-and-so, who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, ask the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.20: And she should ask a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.22: A competent and capable nun should then inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.23: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.24: This trainee nun so-and-so, who has trained under Venerable so-and-so for two years in the six rules, is asking the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.25: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give approval for the trainee nun so-and-so, who has trained for two years in the six rules, to be fully admitted.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.27: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.28: This trainee nun so-and-so, who has trained under Venerable so-and-so for two years in the six rules, is asking the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.29: The Sangha gives approval for the trainee nun so-and-so, who has trained for two years in the six rules, to be fully admitted.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.30: Any nun who approves of giving approval for the trainee nun so-and-so, who has trained for two years in the six rules, to be fully admitted should remain silent.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.31: Any nun who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.32: The Sangha has given approval for the trainee nun so-and-so, who has trained for two years in the six rules, to be fully admitted.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.33: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.34: Then, after criticizing those nuns in many ways for being difficult to support …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.35: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:1.36.1: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to a trainee nun who has trained in the six rules for two years, but who has not been approved by the Sangha, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.8: who has trained in the six rules.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.10: approval to be fully admitted has not been given though a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.13: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastic boundary, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.14: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.15: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.16: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.17: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.18.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.19: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.20: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.21: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.22: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.23: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.25: if she gives the full admission to a trainee nun who has trained in the six rules for two years and who has been approved by the Sangha;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.27: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc64:2.28: The fourth training rule is finished.
